p: We define our study area as mainland England, chosen because a large quantity of reliable, long-running annual count data for birds and Lepidoptera (butterflies and macro-moths) are available at this spatial extent. Although Lepidoptera data are also available from the rest of the United Kingdom, we restricted our analyses to match the spatial extent of the bird data, so that the two groups could be directly compared. We conducted our analyses using R, v. 3.1.0 [ 27].
